data.fullContent: Worldwide, non-compliance is a major obstacle to the effective delivery of health care. In 2003, the World Health Organization estimated that only about half the patients with chronic diseases living in developed countries follow treatment recommendations. In particular, low rates of adherence to therapies for asthma, diabetes, and hypertension are thought to contribute substantially to the human and economic burden of those conditions.
data.answer: 在世界范围内，不遵守规定是有效提供卫生保健的主要障碍。2003年，世界卫生组织估计，生活在发达国家的慢性病患者中，只有大约一半遵循治疗建议。特别是，对哮喘、糖尿病和高血压的治疗依从率低被认为是造成这些疾病的人类和经济负担的主要原因。
